abstract.para: The topic describes the &selnx; policy basics.

topic.para: The policy is the key component in &selnx;. In &selnx;, Mandatory Access Control (MAC) is implemented through security labels known as &selnx; contexts. Each process and system resource is assigned a unique &selnx; security context, also referred to as an &selnx; label. An &selnx; context is an identifier that focuses only on the security properties of the entity. This provides a consistent and unambiguous method for referencing objects within the &selnx; policy.

A &selnx; policy contains a huge number of security contexts and access rules between those security contexts. These are split into modules. This allows the administrator to customize policies for different parts of the system.
